{{Infobox Embedded System |image1 = Banana Pi BPI M5.png |image1_size = 150px |caption = Single Board Computer |caption2 = Banana Pi BPI-M5 |pp = https://www.banana-pi.org/en/banana-pi-sbcs/55.html |sp = <!-- Support page url only --> |dl = <!-- Download page url only --> |wikidevi = <!-- wikidevi.wi-cat.ru page, included underscores --> |wikipedia = <!-- [[wikipedia:Main Page|Wikipedia]] Leave blank for none --> |ddwrtsupport = <!-- Activation, Donation, Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, TBD, Unofficially, WIP --> |openwrtsupport = <!-- Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, WIP, Unofficially, --> |tomatosupport = <!-- Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, WIP, Unofficially, --> |gargoylesupport = <!-- Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, WIP, Unofficially, -->
|brand = Banana Pi |model = BPI M5 |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = (4GB) |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = single-board computer |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = <!-- Federal Communication Commission Identification Number --> |icid = <!-- Industry Canada Identification number, Leave blank for unknown --> |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Amlogic;S905X3; |cpu1_cores = 4 |cpu1_type = ARM |cpu1_type_rev = Cortex-A55 |cpu1spd = 2.0 GHz |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = eMMC 5.1 |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Samsung;KLMAG1JETD-B041; |flash1size = 16 GiB |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = LPDDR4 |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 4 GiB |ram1chip = Micron;PS082-062 BT; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |eth2chip = Realtek;RTL8211F; |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = <!-- Leave blank for unknown -->
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = U-Boot;2015.01;00049-gfe343ff-dirty; |stockos = Linux;4.9.241;Debian 11;
|exp_if_types = USB 3.0, Micro SD Card slot |exp_sim_num = <!-- Number of sim Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_pcmcia_num = <!-- Number of pcmcia ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_expcard_num = <!-- Number of Expresscard ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_minipci_num = <!-- Number of Mini PCI Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_minipcie_num = <!-- Number of Mini PCIexpress Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_usb_num = 4 |exp_cf_num = <!-- Number Compact Flash Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sdmmc_num = 1 |exp_ide_num = <!-- Number of ide ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_ata_num = <!-- Number of ATA Ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sata_num = <!-- Number of sata ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_esata_num = <!-- Number of esata ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_parallel = <!-- Number of parallel ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sfp_num = <!-- Number of sfp ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_M.2 = <!-- Number of M.2 ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_hdmi_num = |usb_hub = <!-- USB hub compatibility -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 3 |pwr_conn = USB Female Type-C
|serial = yes,, 3-pin header,, populated,, 3.3V TTL,, (115200 8N1) |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = Micro SD Card slot, HDMI 2.1, IR receiver, Audio 3.5mm out, UART, I2C, SPI, PWM, GPIO |addchip = Super Speed USB 3.1 Gen1 Hub Controller;VIA Labs;VL817;;1;,,, 4Mbit Serial Multi I/O Flash;Puya Semiconductor;P25Q40H;;1;,,, 5V 1A USB Power Distribution Switch;Silergy;SY6280AAC;;1;,,, 2A 1MHz Synchronous Step-Down Regulator; Silergy;SY8089A;;1;,,, Ultra low dropout 500mA CMOS LDO;Will Semiconductor;WL2803E;;4;,,, 18V 2A Synchronous Step-Down Converter;Silergy Corp;SY8120B1;;4;,,, 300mA CMOS Linear Regulator;First Silicon;FC8731;;2;,,, Microprocessor Supervisory Circuit;SGMicro;SGM803;;1;,,, Ultra Low Capacitance TVS Array;SemTech;RClamp0544T;;6; |802dot11_protocols = none
|defaulip = acquired via DHCP |defaultlogin = root |defaultpass = bananapi |manuf = SinoVoIP |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = CoreELEC, Armbian (unofficial), Volumio, Ubuntu Core, Arch Linux (Arm), Manjaro ARM, Android 9
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = <!-- FCCID approval date --> |estreldate = 09/2020 |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = 9SIB1A6JGV4171 |asin = B08QSD48N2 |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== ===Hardware specification=== *CPU: ''[[Amlogic]]'' S905X3 @2.0GHz :SoC: Quad-core ARM (Cortex-A55) *GPU: Mali-G31 @650MHz (OpenGL ES 3.2, OpenCL 2.0) :VPU (with 4K 10-bit H265/H264 decoding) *Storage: 16GB eMMC 5.1 Flash, :TF card (max.256GB)/MMC Card slot *Memory: 4GB (LPDDR4) *USB: 4x USB 3.0 *Network: 1x Gigabit Ethernet ports *GPIO: 1x 40-pin connector *Power Source: 5V/3A via USB Type-C
==Links of Interest== *[https://wiki.banana-pi.org/Banana_Pi_BPI-M5 ''Banana Pi BPI-M5'' on '''BPi''' Wiki]
*[https://www.hackster.io/news/the-banana-pi-bpi-m5-features-4gb-ram-and-an-optional-wi-fi-usb-dongle-c693c5fc210c ''The Banana Pi BPI-M5 Features 4GB RAM'' on '''Hackster.io'''] *[https://www.cnx-software.com/2020/09/14/banana-pi-bpi-m5-amlogic-s905x3-sbc/ ''Banana Pi BPI-M5 Amlogic S905X3 SBC'' on '''CNX|Software'''] *[https://linuxgizmos.com/fifth-gen-banana-pi-goes-amlogic/ ''Fifth-Gen Banana-Pi Goes Amlogic'' on '''LinuxGizmos''']
